form.label: ASD Essential 8 - User application hardening - Overview

html.p: Block web browser access to Adobe Flash Player (uninstall if possible), web ads and untrusted Java code on the Internet. Flash, Java and web ads have long been popular ways to deliver malware to infect computers. This page provides details on what applications with Java user agents are communicating through your proxy and enabled flash and advertisements.

When reviewing this dashboard, you should pay attention to the trending of allowed domains. Blocked domains should be higher than allowed. If there are no results related to blocked domains there is either an issue with collection of data or you may not be blocking advertisement domains.

search.query: | tstats count from datamodel=Web where (nodename=Web.Proxy (Web.category=*advertisement*) Web.action=blocked) by _time
| tstats count from datamodel=Web where (nodename=Web.Proxy (Web.category=*advertisement* OR Web.dest=*ads*) Web.action=allowed) by _time

| tstats count from datamodel=Web where (nodename=Web.Proxy (Web.http_content_type=*Shockwave* OR Web.http_content_type=*Flash* OR Web.http_user_agent="Java*" OR http_user_agent="*flash")) by _time, Web.action | chart max(count) as count over _time by Web.action

panel.title: Example data sources to power this dashboard

ul.li: Web Proxy Data - Symantec Bluecoat, Websense, Squid Proxy or ZScaler. These sources must log Allows and Blocks to provide accurate data.
Assett Inventory Data - Microsoft Active Directory, CMDB, SCCM. These sources must log the hostnames to allow comparison to Proxy Data.
